meanings.definition: Presenting a claim in opposition to a previous claim.
meanings.sent1: Her counterclaiming in court surprised everyone.
meanings.sent2: The counterclaiming in the legal case added complexity.
meanings.sent3: The counterclaiming during the debate made the audience gasp.
meanings.sent4: His counterclaiming was like a shield against the accusations.
meanings.sent5: The art of counterclaiming requires strategic thinking.

meanings.definition: Asserting a claim in response to an initial claim.
meanings.sent1: She was counterclaiming her innocence vigorously.
meanings.sent2: The company is counterclaiming damages in the lawsuit.
meanings.sent3: He kept counterclaiming playfully during the argument.
meanings.sent4: Their counterclaiming echoed through the courtroom.
meanings.sent5: Counterclaiming can be a way to protect your rights.
